data.title: Meet Our Musicians
data.text:
Alejandro Paredes

Latin, Bossa Nova, Acoustic Guitar and Rock & Roll

Alejandro Paredes spices up his extensive acoustic rock-and-roll repertoire with beautiful Spanish songs, which include several beats such as waltz, bolero and bossa nova. Alejandro has played in many Memphis venues, including hotels, restaurants and Graceland’s Live Music Program.

Listen to his Music below!

Alice Hasen

Alice performs classic rock, popular and Broadway songs on violin, frequently using a loop pedal to create a symphony of sounds. Alice can also provide light classical music to brighten up any space.

Alice Hasen is a Memphis-based violinist, recording artist and songwriter. Alice is known for her unique style which combines the virtuosity of her classical upbringing with soaring improvisation. She has been called “one in a million” by Alan Rowoth, founder of folkmusic.org. Alice formed her solo project, Alice Hasen & the Blaze, in 2018 to allow herself total freedom in songwriting and playing. Her five-piece “fiddle-powered groove band” is rooted in the Memphis heritage of funk, rock and jazz but can stray into pop, blues, and experimental territory. In 2019, she released her debut album, Violintro, which Radio Memphis called "one of the most dynamic sounds out there." Alice serves on the Music Export Memphis Artist Advisory Council and on the board of Southeast Regional Folk Alliance.

https://alicehasen.com/

Benton Parker and The Royal Reds

50's and 60's Blues and Soul

Benton Parker is a singer/songwriter/guitarist born and raised in Jackson, MS. Benton grew up around the sounds of the southern region that have done much to define and enrich American music. Now, living in Memphis and deepening his exploration of the city’s home-brewed brand of these musical stylings, he has found a source of inspiration, focus, and a sense of home. His primary style spans across 50's and 60's and Blues & Soul, with a deep affinity for both and the ability to faithfully recreate them. His exciting live show with his band The Royal Reds brings a fresh energy to these nostalgic sounds you know and love. Get ready to tap your foot and shake your hips!

Big Barton Country & Western Band

Country & Western

Big Barton is a Memphis, TN band that plays classic country and western music from the 1930s-60s, including songs from artists such as Hank Williams, Patsy Cline, Ernest Tubb, and Johnny Cash that will bring you back to the golden era of Nashville's WSM radio. Fronted by Jeremy Shrader (New Memphis Hepcats, Mighty Souls Brass Band), who sings lead vocals and rhythm guitar, and Adam Holton (Mister Adams, Cotton and Coal), on vocal harmonies, lead vocals and bass, the band features some of the Memphis area’s best musicians.

Copy and paste this link in your browser to listen to Big Barton: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FV2QRor4ScA&list=PLvj1kUQLaiEAg7vfDE0O2PjLHZExxm26T

Brazil

Old-time favorites

Brazil covers the music of artists including Michael Franks, Frank Sinatra, Johnny Mathis, Tony Bennett, Lionel Richie, Charlie Pride, Elvis Presley, Nat King Cole and many others. He has opened concerts for Jerry Lee Lewis, Cameo, Alexander O’Neal, Weather Report, and Santa Esmeralda and performed with George Duke and many others. He has performed for many government dignitaries, including President Lyndon Johnson and American troops in Europe.

Brazil has performed all over the world including the United States, Great Britain, Germany, Belgium, Saudi Arabia, Israel, Egypt, Austria, Japan, Canada, the Azores, the Virgin Islands, and Indonesia.

Available Thursday and Friday all day and after 6:00pm daily.

Listen to his Music below!

Brooke and Nathan

Piano and Vocal Duo Playing Soul, Musical Theatre, Jazz, Rock, Blues

Brooke and Nathan perform top 40 hits from the 50's and 60's, featuring artists like Elvis Presley, Rosemary Clooney, Fats Domino, The Everly Brothers, Doris Day, The Coasters, Roy Orbison, Patsy Cline, Jerry Lee Lewis, and many more. With Nathan on piano and vocals alongside Brooke's killer voice, audiences are sure to have fun. Brooke and Nathan moved to Memphis in 2015 to work as Actors at Playhouse On the Square. Since then, they've been seen all around Memphis performing a variety of styles and genres. Nathan trained on the piano in Nashville and plays solo gigs all around town, as well as band gigs including the Memphis Jazz Orchestra. Brooke performs a smattering of lead roles in musicals at Playhouse On the Square, ranging across many different musical styles. Brooke and Nathan can also customize setlists to your entertainment needs, with many setlist options including traditional Jazz, Classic Showtunes, Southern Gospel, and more. Click the link to see some recent performance videos.

https://www.nathanmchenry.com/creative-aging

Candy Fox & Accompanist

R&B, Soul, Jazz & Blues; Vocals with Accompanist

Growing up in Memphis, Candy Fox started singing in church at age 3. She earned a BA in Communications from Boston College, singing in Boston College’s gospel choir. Candy landed a spot in the Top 100” during the second season of American Idol. She returned to her hometown and lent her sultry vocals and fiery-energy to the hip-hop/rock/soul band Free Sol, who won the 2003 Mid-South Grammy Showcase and released an album, 11:11. Candy has made music and toured nationally and internationally with some of industry’s best, including David Porter, William Bell, Toni Green and the late great J Blackfoot from Stax Records, Howard Hewett & Shalimar, and Cherelle. She has played with Memphis hometown favorites Wendy Moten, Reba Russell, Kirk Whalum, and Larry Dodson of the Barkays. Candy is currently part of the Sounds of Vinyl production, which takes diverse audiences on a riveting trip through the American musical landscape. She performs regularly in the Grizzlies House Band at FedEx Forum. Candy and her accompanist will delight your group!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LpxliZTu9E8, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=io6Jyqab-oQ

Cecil Yancy and John Albertson

A History of Bluegrass Music

What happens when a storyteller with a guitar on his back joins forces with a multi-instrumentalist? Cecil Yancy's "A History of Bluegrass Music Through the Eyes of Bill Monroe, featuring John Albertson" takes you on a tour of the Scottish Highlands, the Appalachian Mountains and the blues. Along the way, you'll clap your hands, stomp your feet, sing the songs and experience music that combines all three forms into a gumbo of sounds that folks started calling bluegrass shortly after Bill Monroe and His Bluegrass Boys brought the sound to the stage of the Grand Ole Opry. Guitar, fiddle and mandolin joined on stage by their "fifth cousin," the banjo, along with the stories behind the songs and the music.

Darryl Evan Jones

Instrumental Soul

In the tradition of pioneering contemporary jazz greats like Tim Weisberg and Hubert Laws, Darryl Evan Jones, long known by his fans and peers as “The Fluteman” brings the unique instrument’s classic vibe and rich melodic and harmonic possibilities to a new generation. Darryl Evan Jones' journey has brought him to performances stages like The Cannon Center in Memphis, Philadelphia's Mandell Theater, and the Capital Jazz Fest. He's also been the opening act for artists like Jeff Lorber, Kem, and Boney James. The musical style of Darryl Evan Jones is truly original; combining the genres of Jazz, Classical, and Gospel music. He calls his style Instrumental Soul. Darryl insists that he’s a soul singer who can’t sing, but expresses his emotions through the flute.

https://dejmusic.com/

David Evans

Blues

David Evans has had a double career since the early 1960s as a music performer and a researcher, scholar, writer, and teacher. As a blues and folk musician he has recorded six CDs for the Inside Sounds (USA) and Blind Lemon (Germany) labels and has made over seventy tours in twenty-two countries of Europe, South America, and Africa. He has toured, performed, and/or recorded with such blues greats as Hammie Nixon, Van Zula Hunt, Johnny Shines, Robert Belfour, Jack Owens, Jessie Mae Hemphill, and Al Wilson (Canned Heat). Evans learned most of his repertoire and style directly from these and other traditional blues artists he met in the course of his research. He recently retired after 38 years as Professor of Music at The University of Memphis. Evans has authored Tommy Johnson (1971), Big Road Blues: Tradition and Creativity in the Folk Blues (1982), The NPR Curious Listener’s Guide to Blues (2005), Going up the Country: Adventures in Blues Fieldwork in the 1960s (2022, with Marina Bokelman) and edited Ramblin’ on My Mind: New Perspectives on the Blues (2008), as well as many articles, reviews, album notes, and LP and CD productions of traditional blues and gospel artists, many of them for the university’s High Water Records. His album notes have won two Grammy™ awards. Since 1997 Evans has been the series editor of the “American Made Music” book series of University Press of Mississippi, with more than 100 books published to date. Besides fieldwork and recording in African-American blues and folk music, he has done further field research, recording, and publication on the music of Venezuela, Ethiopia, and Malaŵi.

David Virone

Vocals, Guitar, Mandolin & Inter-generational Performances

David is a charismatic performer, with 20 years of guitar playing & singing experience. He specializes in traditional American Folk music, Country, Gospel and good ol’ Rock n’ Roll (1950s-1970s); his sets include a range from the Carter Family to Chuck Berry. David has command over a dozen other instruments including bass, banjo, ukulele, violin, cello and piano to name a few; however he’s most often seen swapping between guitar and mandolin during his captivating performances.

David also leads inter-generational performances. A lead instructor with the well-known music education group Music for Aardvarks, David brings together young and old alike with his music workshops that are designed to be enjoyed by multiple age groups.

Click here to visit his website.

Deborah Swiney

jazz and blues vocals & keyboard

Deborah Swiney has earned the title of a true chanteuse. Throughout her performance, you get to enjoy a trip back to Harlem to experience the iconic era of Billie Holiday and Ella Fitzgerald, dance across the Great American Songbook, and take a flight to Rio where you could close your eyes and imagine relaxing on the Copacabana or Ipanema beach. Being a Memphis native, you might even get a splash of blues. Deborah’s affinity for music started at an early age with piano lessons and being musically active in both church and school. Growing up in a musical family, music had no borders. In addition to touring internationally, Deborah has worked as a backup vocalist with the legendary Al Green and performed on the Oprah Winfrey Show, the Today Show, and at Carnegie Hall. More recently, she released the highly praised co-produced debut album, I Remember Rio, a Brazilian inspired album with “Memphis-Soul seasoning” (All about Jazz). Transcending the standard definition of a Jazz songstress, her melodic and sultry approach to Bossa Nova and other Brazilian stylings are natural without betraying her Bluff City roots. To hear Deborah's latest music, click on her website.

https://www.deborahswiney.com

Doug MacLeod

Blues Musician and Storyteller

MacLeod is an international touring artist known for his superb songwriting, guitar wizardry, warm soulful vocals, wit, and unforgettable live performances. At the heart of a Doug MacLeod performance is his knack for storytelling, bringing characters-from the faceless to the legendary-to strikingly real life. Doug is a multiple Blues Music Award winner, including the 2020 Blues Music Award for Acoustic Artist of the Year and the 2018 Blues Music Award for Acoustic Album of the Year for ‘Break The Chain’. He was recently nominated for the 2022 Blues Music Award for Acoustic Artist of the Year. In March 2022, Doug co-authored with Debra Schiff the blues murder mystery book MURDER AT THE CROSSROADS. Over 30 years, 22 studio albums, several live records, compilations, a blues guitar instructional DVD, and a live performance DVD, MacLeod has consistently earned raves. His songs have been covered by many artists including Albert King, Albert Collins, Joe Louis Walker and Eva Cassidy. MacLeod's songs have been featured in many TV movies. August Wilson requested his soulful slide guitar playing in the Los Angeles opening of "Gem of the Ocean”. He's played with George 'Harmonica' Smith, Big Joe Turner, Pee Wee Crayton, Eddie 'Cleanhead' Vinson, Lowell Fulson, and Big Mama Thornton. Like the old masters who taught him, MacLeod's music expresses life and times through an intangible, elusive quality that may simply be a keen sense of what matters most. Doug’s music, stories, and philosophy provide a healing that has helped others overcome the hardships of their lives.

https://doug-macleod.com/

Elmo and Lester

Elmo and Lester was formed in 2017 by two former Overton High School classmates and has been having a successful run since. The duo had a residency at The Graceland Guesthouse and have played restaurants, wineries, parties, senior communities, and more. Their show is a high energy journey through a variety of musical styles and eras, from the American Songbook, 50’s & 60’s Rock & Roll, Country, Blues, Jazz, Rhythm and Blues, and beyond. "Elmo” Lee Thomas is a Memphis native, best known as the leader of iconic Memphis Band Elmo and the Shades. Elmo has long been recognized as one of the region’s top harmonica talents, and is equally capable of lighting up the stage with his roots inspired guitar approach. He has performed on NPR's Beale Street Caravan, had an appearance on Bud Light's "Spotlight on Memphis" commercial, and sang two songs on the 2013 major motion picture "Crackerjack” produced by Jeff Foxworthy. In the Spring of 2015, he toured Vietnam sponsored by the United States State department, representing Memphis Music to celebrate the normalization of relations between Vietnam and the U.S. Bruce Lester is easily one of the finest guitar players in the area. Gaining prominence in the 80's as a member of the critically acclaimed “Beat Cowboys," Bruce has played in several local groups. Recently, he has been working as an accomplished studio musician. Mr. Lester’s ability to play all genres of music with skill and taste has been one of the reasons for his success in the Memphis Music scene. Elmo and Lester are sure to get the room moving and smiling!

Ensemble X

Dynamic and modern string quartet with vocals playing genres from classical to pop.

Ensemble X is a collective of musicians from Memphis, TN that blurs the lines of genre by performing a wide range of music from classical music, jazz and R & B, and even billboard top 40 hits. We are ambassadors of music holding the belief that there is only one type of music, good music. The core members Jerald Walker, Renicea Bell, Mario Williams, and Joseph Miller are all graduates of the Rudi E Scheidt School of Music at The University of Memphis. Formed in 2021, Ensemble X has performed at many venues in the mid-south including The Overton Park Shell and the Crosstown Green Room. Mario Williams is the founder and creative director of Ensemble X. His vision was to create an ensemble consisting of black classically trained musicians that can be a shining light and example to young musicians of color. Mario earned his B.M. in Viola Performance from the University of Memphis. He has performed with several orchestras in the mid-south area. With a background in hip-hop and fiddle playing, he is a versatile musician well prepared to playing in any setting. Jerald Walker violin/composer/arranger - Jerald Walker has composed three symphonies and has been one of the most sought-after string arrangers in Memphis. His arrangements are the heart and soul of Ensemble X’s unique sound. Renicea Bell, violinist/vocalist – Renicea Bell, a gifted violinist and singer, has been praised for her soulful voice and instrumental tone. Her reputation as an improv violinist has landed her on albums and stages with many touring artists that play Memphis. Joseph Miller cellist- Joseph Miller has performed with ensembles such as Sinfonietta Memphis, Memphis Repertory Orchestra, The Jackson Symphony and more. Miller’s cello can be heard on many recordings coming out of Memphis for artists such as Aaron James, The Reputations, Tyke T and many others.

Flamenco Memphis

Flamenco Memphis presents: ¡Olé!

Flamenco Memphis is offering 3 options to bring this captivating performance of live flamenco guitar, dancing, and singing to your community! The first performance option offered is a duo which includes Noelia Garcia Carmona (dance & percussion) and Roy Brewer (guitar) who will bring you an exciting and passionate presentation of Spanish rhythms and songs. The second option is a trio which includes dance, guitar, a vocalist; and the third option is a quartet of 2 dancers, a guitarist, and a vocalist. Please note that communities requesting Flamenco Memphis must have a space with a wooden floor for the dancing, a stage or dance floor will work; the group cannot perform on carpet, concrete, or linoleum.

Graham Winchester

Solo Guitar or Piano with Vocals

Graham Winchester is a songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, engineer, and producer from Memphis, TN. Growing up quickly in the famed music city, he started playing professionally in clubs by middle school. Kin to the late songwriting legend Jesse Winchester, music is and will always be in his blood. When he isn’t performing as a solo artist or recording, Winchester plays live frequently with a multitude of bands throughout Memphis and is a music teacher, tour guide at the legendary Sun Studio, and co-owner of Blast Habit Records. When performing solo on piano or guitar, Winchester likes to perform songs from Sun Records, Stax Records, and classic rock n’ roll and country songs.

Hank & Stan

Vocals, guitar and flute

Hank Sable moved to Memphis in 1993 to open a vintage guitar store across from the Peabody Hotel. He met Memphis musicians and began performing regularly. Hank has been a member of the Joyce Cobb band for 15 years, playing every Sunday for the Boscos’ brunch. Hank also performs with Nora Tucker, at the River Inn, and at Paulette’s. A long-time Creative Aging musician, Hank plays guitar and violin. Memphis born Woodwinds Master, Stan Jackson was exposed to music at an early age. He plays flute, percussion and keyboards. Stan has worked with music industry notables Quincy Jones, Jackson Brown and Kirk Whalum. He performed frequently in the cast of Puccini's La Boheme with the Los Angeles Opera. Stan successfully built and ran a state of the art Music Multi-Media Center at the Magnet School, Washington Prep Music Academy, in South Central Los Angeles. Since moving back to Memphis, Stan has performed with Joyce Cobb on Sundays at Boscos’ brunch with Hank Sable. Hank and Stan will delight your audiences.

Listen to their music below!

Jeremy Clement

Vocals & Guitar

Jeremy Clement’s performances are tailored to create a full-ensemble sound, even though he is a solo performer! He specializes in performing popular songs most favored by today’s retirees, and has songs for every occasion or holiday, including Christmas, Mardis Gras, Patriotic events, Halloween, Summer/Island/Hawaii sounds, and many more! Jeremy’s shows always feature familiar songs, and humor, which are sure to get the whole crowd singing along, laughing, and engaging in the show, and with one another. Jeremy has entertained around the world and across the country for over three decades and is a regular fixture in the greater Memphis area. During his full-time professional music career, Jeremy has been a Nashville Studio musician, a player in the 90’s alternative rock scene in Seattle, an educator, and a musical director aboard luxury cruise ships. He has also served as worship leader. A humorous, energetic, and engaging performer, Jeremy has appeared on recordings and stages with the likes of Alan Jackson, Phil Vassar, The Judds, Vince Gill & Amy Grant, and many others.

Listen to his music here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N-e7FYaCZ7Q

Jim Duckworth

Jim Duckworth, now a retired school teacher, started playing guitar in 1969 and has played throughout the United States and Europe. Jim made a handful of records before he dedicated himself to teaching full time. Keeping musically active as he taught, Jim played with John Kilzer, Frank Lowe, Carla Thomas, Fred Ford and Honeymoon Garner, Joyce Cobb and a host of others. Currently he sustains a thirty-five year plus ongoing duo with Memphis Saxophone legend Jim Spake and collaborates with his talented wife, singer songwriter Kimberly Koehler. You can request Jim as solo guitar or a duo with a vocalist. As a soloist fond of playing his old acoustic Gibson, Jim explores the great American songbook featuring George Gershwin, Rogers and Hart, Duke Ellington, and so forth. Jim has a great love of American folk music and enjoys presenting folk songs for young and old in tandem with his wife on vocals.

Joyce Cobb & Band

vocals & guitar

“One of Memphis’s great musical treasures.” —Christopher Blank, Memphis Commercial Appeal, and the Best Local Singer in the Memphis Flyer's Best of 2018!

As a singer, teacher, and actor, Joyce has done it all: Signed a deal at Stax Records; cut a Top 40 hit, “Dig The Gold,” for the Cream label; opened shows for The Temptations, Muddy Waters, and Al Jarred; toured Europe; performed with the Memphis Symphony Orchestra; and starred in local productions of Ain’t Misbehavin’ and the Center For Southern Folklore’s Beale Street Saturday Night (which she co-created). Born in Oklahoma and reared in Nashville, Joyce has been immersed in music since her childhood days singing in her grandmother’s church.

Listen Here:

Julia Cruz Magness

Bring Julia's Blues to your community as duo, a trio, or a full five-piece band. Jazz, Blues, R&B, Gospel, Country and Pop.

“A little bit of Bessie Smith and a lot of Janis, powerhouse songstress Julia Cruz Magness can belt with the best of them-but her voice marries gutsy attitude with a surprisingly smooth and crystal- clear tone.” - Allie Eissler, Texas Music Magazine Summer 2012 Issue 51 (Aug 01, 2012). Julia Cruz Magness originally hails from Austin, TX where she performed with The Original Bells of Joy gospel group in Austin Texas for over a decade. Julia moved to Memphis in 2016 and now sings at The Peabody Hotel as a duo most Fridays from 4-7 pm. You can see her regularly with a band at The Gold Strike Casino, Hard Rock Cafe, and on the Riverboat dinner cruises. She is also a soprano in The Tennessee Mass Choir. In 2012 her band Miss Julia and The Cruzers won the Austin Blues Society's Blues Challenge and represented Austin Texas in Memphis at the International Blues Challenge. She also represented Memphis in 2019 as a duo with Chad Pope. Julia will release her debut Blues album in 2023. It is being produced by Boo Mitchell and recorded at Royal Studios with many of the original members of the Hi Rhythm Section. Julia can be heard on songs by artists that include Gary P Nunn, The Push Stars, The Moeller Brothers and Bracken Hale.

http://juliasblues.com/

Julianne Thomas & Dom Fosco

Vocals, Piano, & Sax

Julianne and Dom have been making music all of their lives. They each have many accomplishments in their long careers but along the way, the best reward is the love of sharing what they do. Julianne offers a stirring vocal style with a joyful presence while Dom is an amazing instrumentalist on keyboard, sax, and backgrounds. Their repertoire includes traditional jazz, standards, blues, and R&B. Everyone will sing and smile, swoon over the tunes, and tap their toes while Julianne and Dom create a journey back in time that is “Unforgettable.”

Click here for samples of Julianne and Dom performing.

https://soundcloud.com/juliannethomas?ref=clipboard&p=i&c=0&si=4C6468C971B54013BA54D8A32325CEA8&utm_source=clipboard&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=social_sharing

Just Friends Band

Jazz, Vintage Standards, & Rock-n- Roll

Just Friends Band members Larry Tyler, Kelley Walker and Wes Walker will delight audiences with skilled renditions of pop, jazz standards, rock, country, and gospel. Larry Tyler is skilled on both guitar and keyboard and provides vocals on a wide repertoire of material, including pop, jazz standards, rock, country, and gospel. Wes Walker plays the saxophone, flute, and clarinet and has performed professionally around the region for the past 30 years, including in productions of West Side Story, Will Rogers Follies, A Chorus Line, and The King and I. Wes has backed prominent entertainers, including Johnny Mathis, Burt Bachrach, Wayne Newton, The Temptations, The Four Tops, and the Tommy Dorsey Band. Wes’s experience includes the Memphis Jazz Orchestra and the Memphis Symphony Pops Concerts. Kelley Walker has performed around the Memphis area for over 30 years with various bands, singing rock and roll, old standards and top 40 hits in venues including the Peabody Hotel, The Memphis Country Club, and Mud Island. Listen to their music below!

https://assets.speakcdn.com/assets/2570/demo_for__friends_.mp3

Kenneth Jackson

Vocalist, horns, piano, blues workshop

Kenneth Jackson is a dynamic entertainer and master teaching artist. His vocal style is reminiscent of Lou Rawls and Barry White. An accomplished composer, trumpeter, guitarist, and pianist, Kenneth began his professional career at age 14. Kenneth tours nationally, has been featured at the Kennedy Center and the Smithsonian Institute, and has performed worldwide with renowned artists B.B. King, Ray Charles, Johnny Taylor, Lou Rawls, Solomon Burke, Sam and Dave, the Dells, and others. Kenneth has been broadcast on CNN and his work has been featured in numerous local and national publications. Kenneth also presents a 1-hour workshop, History of the Blues, that explores the Blues as an American musical art form that has influenced many other musical genres around the world. This informative and educational workshop traces the chronological history of the blues from work songs to field hollers and urban styles. Kenneth keeps the audience engaged with fun interactive activities and brief performances.

Click here to watch Kenneth perform.

Kreston Smith

Jazz Saxophone Solo

Kreston Smith is a multi-instrumentalist from the Mid-South Area & Memphis, TN who brings an ambience of memories to any occasion. He has been on the stage at numerous live events and recording studio sessions with The Ethan Smith Band, The Mid-South Jazz Combo, Thumpdaddy, The Sexton Connection, Southern Comfort, The Rhythm Rockets, and many more. Kreston plays the saxophone to an expansive list of music that meets the tastes of any one in attendance and fills the dance floor with heart pumping dance music as a DJ that ignites the energy to any crowd!

https://www.krestonsmith.com/

Kris Grauel and Yolanda Harper

Piano and Vocals

Piano man and singer, Kris Grauel moved to Memphis from Wisconsin in 2002 and began playing local senior centers as a solo artist. Kris met vocalist Yolanda Harper in 2011 and the two have been a musical duo ever since, touring under the name Double Entendre and playing senior centers, festivals, restaurants, and bars. Kris and Yolanda play popular music from a variety of genres and decades. They are able to work with you to play exactly what you're community wants to hear! Available to schedule as a solo or duo.

Linda Herring

Piano and Vocals Covering Gospel, Jazz, Broadway and More

Linda Herring stands as a true luminary in the realm of music and education. As a distinguished minister of music, she has enriched the spiritual lives of congregations with her passion and mastery of worship arts through piano and voice for over 60 years. Linda's career extends beyond the sanctuary walls, embracing the vibrant worlds of show tunes, oldies, and classical masterpieces. She has given countless memorable performances including performing with the Memphis Symphony, under the direction of the late Alan Balter. In 2014, at the 22nd Annual Trumpet Awards Ceremony held in Atlanta, Linda was honored with the prestigious “Spiritual Enlightenment Award” as a Renowned Religious Leader in Gospel Clarity. Beyond her accomplishments as a performer and director, Linda is an esteemed educator, teaching piano and voice to aspiring artists, nurturing their talents and helping them discover their own musical voices. As a solo performer, Linda has captivated audiences. These intimate performances offer a glimpse into her soulful interpretations and the profound emotional connection she brings to every piece. In addition to her teaching and solo work, Linda has graced the stage as an accomplished accompanist, enhancing the performances of a diverse array of musical artists including James Hyter, "Old Man River”. Her collaborative spirit and innate ability to elevate others' performances have solidified her reputation as a consummate professional. Linda continues to inspire and shape the musical landscape, remaining a beacon of musical excellence, a cherished mentor, and an enduring pillar of the musical community.

Memphis Sideshow

Vocals & Guitar

John Groesse—singer and bassist—and Hal VanCanneyt–singer and guitarist—make up the Memphis Sideshow. They perform oldies, standards, country, blues, R&B, gospel and rock, adding their unique spin to the music with the assistance of tracks created in their studio, giving the sound of a full band. Memphis Sideshow offers an eclectic mix of material that will make you want to get up and dance or a least tap your feet and sing along. Visit their website at www.memphissideshow.com, or listen below. John & Hal create lasting memories through music!

Click here to listen to some of their music.

Michael Donahue

Jazz to Broadway to Hollywood on the Piano

Michael has been playing piano for decades in Memphis. He was the weekly pianist at Cielo Restaurant, and has played numerous country clubs, private parties, and he used to play for his mother's nursing home. He is truly a native of Memphis, a graduate from CBHS and Memphis State, and you may know him better as local journalist for the Memphis Flyer and formerly of the Commercial Appeal. Michael plays a range that includes works by Cole Porter, George Gershwin, show tunes, songs from movies, and lots of upbeat pieces, which can get people dancing and singing along. He is always happy to take requests. *Communities booking Michael Donahue must already have a tuned piano available on site*

Michelle Shrader

Guitar and Vocals

Michelle Shrader focused on training her voice for several years as a child before picking up the guitar at the age of sixteen. She had an aptitude for the instrument, and began writing songs within six weeks of her first lesson and recording within six months. After moving to Memphis in 2006 to study classical guitar with Lily Afshar, the world-renowned guitarist at the University of Memphis, she fell in love with the city. Michelle is now a popular fixture in the local music scene performing her own songs and classical guitar selections; and she has been featured in local media including videos by Live From Memphis and Hotel Memphis. She regularly performs locally for many private events and at venues such as the Germantown Performing Arts Center. With her husband, trumpeter and singer Jeremy Shrader, Michelle sings jazz and bossa nova in small and large band settings. She regularly sits-in with his country band, Big Barton, singing songs by Gillian Welch (one of her favorites) and Patsy Cline. Michelle is available as a solo artist and with bands ranging from two to five pieces.

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLvj1kUQLaiEDb8VLyXLMqxwJTMKlo59lX

Music From Movies with Jeff and Aaron

This Duo including Guitar, Accordion, and Vocals perform Simon & Garfunkel, Peter Gabriel, Nino Rota and More!

Jeff Hulett and Aaron Brame are two friends who use their musical talents and love of movies to create an engaging and unique performance. Join them as they perform memorable works such as Simon & Garfunkel (from The Graduate), Nino Rota (The Godfather), or Peter Gabriel (Say Anything) with guitar and accordion accompaniment. The duo will share their passion for film music, discussing its impact on the cinematic experience and the enduring appeal of these classic songs. Your community can prepare for a performance that celebrates the power of music in film, filled with insightful commentary and a shared love for the movies.

Oveante Magsby

Piano, Jazz, Gospel

Oveante (oh-vee-ahn-tay) Magsby is a Memphis native and graduated from Berklee College of Music where he studied piano, voice, and songwriting. He would love to come serenade your community with jazz, gospel, and R&B classics. Oveante has been featured as a soloist for the 2006 Freedom Awards in Memphis honoring Stevie Wonder and has appeared in frequent concerts throughout Memphis. He was awarded second place in the Savannah Swing Central Jazz national competition; and he won the Omega Psi Phi Fraternity International Talent Hunt, which allowed him to perform at Caesar’s Palace in 2016. He was also first place winner at PBS’s Celebration of Music competition in Boston, performing at the Wilbur Theater in 2018. Selected from a national search, OVEANTE played piano with a professional jazz ensemble on the recording of “Strange Fruit Revisited” featuring Broadway star, Tonya Pinkins in 2021. In May 2022, OVEANTE released his first EP of original piano solos, Have a Seat, streaming everywhere. Currently, he is writing and recording with his colleagues in the band, Mid Air Decision, and for his next solo EP. OVEANTE is the minister of music for his home church at New Galilee Baptist church in Memphis, TN. He hopes that through his music, lives will be impacted for the better and the world will heal. He states that music is for the glory of GOD. And Favor takes you to places that one can only dream of.

https://oveantemusic.com/

Robb Zelonky

Guitar and Vocals- Folk, Classic Rock, Hebrew and Yiddish

Robb ‘Robbo’ Zelonky has performed for senior communities ever since he was a child, accompanying his parents in the Chicagoland area. For the past forty-five years, he has performed for seniors all across America, specializing in an array of popular American folk songs, sixties and seventies classic rock, and even Hebrew and Yiddish favorites. His special bond with his own grandmother, Goldie, imparted within him a deep love and appreciation for seniors, and he looks forward to meeting your group and entertaining them as well!

Shaun Simmonds

Blues

Shaun Simmonds learned the power and potential of music early on. Growing up in southern England, he initially keyed into early pop, soul and rockabilly. In his forties, Shaun discovered the true roots of the music he loved while listening to Robert Johnson recordings. The Blues was a revelation, and Shaun began to develop his craft of playing old style acoustic country blues from recordings of the early musicians. These rich and lonesome strands of storytelling brought Shaun to Memphis, where he continues to study in the shadow of this powerful music that defines our city. His solo acoustic guitar repertoire ranges from Robert Johnson to Charley Patton, from Skip James to Big Bill Broonzy, as well as greats like Johnny Cash, Elvis and Otis Redding. Shaun’s performances create an atmosphere of true emotion and tell the story of how this great music changed the sound of popular music throughout the world.

Side Street Steppers

Music of yesteryear

The Side Street Steppers are a page from America’s past, playing rare and popular music from the 1920s and 30s. Dubbed the Golden Age of Gramophone Recording, the two decades between 1920 and World War II saw the rise of jazz and the birth of the blues, the demise of ragtime and the emergence of hillbilly music that would become known through the world as country music. The Side Street Steppers present a pastiche of this transformation of the American musical landscape, performing on vintage and homemade instruments. Get ready for plenty of hip-shaking, foot stompin’, caterwauling and croonin’.

Click Here to see the Side Street Steppers on YouTube.

Stephanie Bradley

Solo Guitar & Vocals; or Soul Expressions Band

Stephanie Bradley came to Memphis from Austin, TX where she regularly played with Blues Boy Hubbard and TT Brown, well-known blues and chitlin circuit musicians. Stephanie was born with a passion for music and began singing harmonies with an older sister in 1965. She then learned to play the piano, guitar, & bass guitar. These instruments have provided great joy throughout a long musical career of singing jazz, classic soul, and blues music. You can choose to bring Stephanie to your community as a solo with guitar, or with her Memphis made Soul Expressions Band. People are sure to find themselves singing, tapping, clapping along!

Stephen White

vocalist

Stephen Len White is a native Memphian and classically trained vocalist who will bring anything from the American Songbook, a show for Veterans or Christian music, and mix in some opera and classical for you to enjoy. He has performed with the New York Grand Opera, the Bronx Opera, the European Opera Ascona, and Opera Memphis in works including La Boheme, La Traviata, and Il Barber di Siviglia. He is equally trained on the musical stage and has appeared in dramas and musicals, including appearances in The Sound of Music and As You Like it, with the Cumberland County Playhouse, Playhouse on the Square, and the Tennessee Shakespeare Company. He and his wife Deborah on piano will have you singing along with them in no time.

Steve Lee

Jazz Pianist

Stephen Lee is a Memphis native who began playing piano at the age of 8 and has never looked back. He studied jazz at the University of Tennessee with Jazz legend Donald Brown before moving to New York City, where he shared the stage with stars including Esperanza Spaulding, Corcoran Holt, Ulysses Owens, Jr., Billy Johnson, Gregory Porter and highly lauded fellow Memphian Kirk Whalum. Steve has been nominated for numerous gospel music awards. He has taught at Stax Music Academy, Visible Music College, and Overton and Booker T. Washington High Schools. He is the publisher of “In Concert Magazine”, which promotes jazz in over 152 different countries. He will delight your community with jazz standards and other familiar piano tunes.

https://www.leejazzomega.com/about

Tanisha Ward

Vocal and Piano Duo featuring Classical, Spiritual, Broadway

Soprano Tanisha Ward has been heard in a variety of venues in her native Memphis, Tennessee and beyond. A former Artist-in-Residence with Opera Memphis and the winner of an Emerging Artist Grant from Arts Memphis, Ms. Ward has been seen in supporting and featured roles with several Opera Memphis productions including Aida, Tremonisha, Porgy & Bess, and Turandot and covered the leading soprano role of Euridice in Gluck’s Orpheus. She was Gretel in Opera Memphis’s outreach tour of Hansel and Gretel and was featured in a one-woman show entitled Black Roots of Opera for the company in honor of Black History Month. Additional credits include the Church Soloist in Playhouse on the Square’s award-wining production of The Color Purple, featured soloist in Art for Life’s Sake, and international tours in recital for D&P Joubert Worldwide. She holds the Bachelor of Music degree in Vocal Performance from the University of Memphis and the Master of Music degree in Vocal Performance from the University of Mississippi (Ole Miss). Ms. Ward has been a frequent prize winner in regional NATS competitions. She has appeared with symphonies, theatre's, and opera companies including, but not limited to, Mississippi Symphony Orchestra, Memphis Wind Symphony, New York Lyric Opera (New York), Carnegie Hall (New York), Red Mountain Theatre (Birmingham,AL), Moon River Opera (Savannah, GA), and Hattiloo Theatre (Memphis, TN.). In the fall of 2023, Ms. Ward made her company/ role debut with St. Croix Falls Festival Theatre (St. Croix Falls, WI), and with the Sanctuary Jazz Orchestra (Memphis, TN). She will also make her debut with the Memphis Symphony Orchestra, Germantown Symphony Orchestra, and Theatre Memphis in 2024. When Ms. Ward is not performing, she is working tirelessly with her nonprofit Classical Melodies, Inc. Its primary focus is granting access to quality, professional musicians and sharing Classical Vocal music with underserved/ under-represented communities, particularly school-aged, at-risk children/ communities of color.

https://www.tanishalward.com/

Taylor Orr

Solo or Duo for Blues, 60's & 70's, Bluegrass, Old Country

Taylor has been playing guitar and singing for 30 years. He has played thousands of gigs all over the country and internationally. He currently plays with Ghost Town Blues Band and works as a music history guide for Backbeat Tours in downtown Memphis. While blues is his forte, Taylor also loves to play all sixties and 70s music, bluegrass, old country, and some jazz and 50s music. Taylor can provide solo acoustic gigs and also has an upright bass player, if your community would like a duo. Click the link below to hear him play with his Beale Street band Ghost Town Blues Band.

https://open.spotify.com/album/7fBTQXJjxGcg0PTak5nom6?si=h2EvnnpdTbmR9EnyvwA8oQ

Tim Stanek

Solo pianist

Tim plays jazz, ragtime, country, gospel, classical and boogie-woogie piano as well as arrangements of popular tunes from the 30’s and 40s. A native Memphian, Tim graduated from the University of Memphis Jazz Piano Performance Program in 2011 and began performing at various venues, including retirement communities, as a solo pianist. Tim’s repertoire stems from audience member’s requests. Although Tim does not sing in his performances, he encourages the audience to sing along, hum, or tap dance on the table with their fingers! Tim’s full length album, “Sweet Memories”, honors the smiling seniors who have inspired his music over the years.

Listen to his Music below!

Turnstyles

Rock, 50’s/60’s Surf, Classic Country

Turnstyles is a Memphis, Tennessee duo made up of Seth Moody on guitar and Graham Winchester on the drums. Both musicians sing in harmony together over a wide variety of musical styles. Moody and Winchester have developed a strong on-stage chemistry, having played together in the Reigning Sound, Jack Oblivian Band, Cassette Set, Arc of Quasar, Coco & the Hitmen, and many other projects. Turnstyles can perform as a more upbeat drum/guitar duo, or a piano/guitar duo for a quieter setting. The common setlist is a blend of original tunes mixed with the best cuts of Sun Records, Stax Records, 50’s/60’s surf, classic country, and much more!
